intro: Popowia bequaertii, commonly known as the Bequaert's popowia, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
